physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The 15-yr-old girl presented with mild mesomelic shortening of the forearms and lower legs. Radio-graphic evaluation revealed a mild triangulation of the carpal bones. Karyotype was normal, and serum levels of IGF-I, IGFBP-3, T4, TSH, and FSH were in the normal range.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The girl's height increased from 142.0 cm (22.2 SDS) to 149.0 cm (22.4 SDS) over time.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Height of the girl (G) was recorded as 89.6 cm (23.6 SDS) at 4 years; the boy (B) was 106.8 cm (22.6 SDS) at 6.4 years. Both children had no dysmorphic features.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Both children showed improvement in height during rhGH treatment; height increased from 23.5 SDS to 22.5 SDS (G) and from 22.5 SDS to 21.6 SDS (B). Growth velocity for G was 9.5 cm/yr and for B was 9.4 cm/yr.
